LEAD: As talk stirs of getting on the natural gas bandwagon [ ''Energy Battle Looms Over Gas Pipelines,'' Oct. 23 ] , let me share my prophesy.
As talk stirs of getting on the natural gas bandwagon [ ''Energy Battle Looms Over Gas Pipelines,'' Oct. 23 ] , let me share my prophesy.

America will start burning natural gas in huge quantities for heating and generating electircity, using it in the same wasteful way we now use oil, coal and nuclear fuel. Then there will be a natural gas shortage and we will be left with the choice of relaxing air standards to burn more coal, or risk higher cancer rates from using more nuclear power. Natural gas is a finite nonrenewable fuel that will be exhausted.

We need to use our nonrenewable fuels (including natural gas) to give us the precious time and energy we need to research, build and install energy-saving technologies like cogeneration, home insulation and public transportation and to develop renewable energy resources like solar, wind, biomass and hydropower. These are energy resources found right here, are environmentally sound and job creating, and best of all, they are eternal.

Displacing the other nonrenewable fuels with natural gas while operating in a business-as-usual manner in our energy consumptive habits is like eating our seed stock. When the natural gas party is over, we will be in a more desperate situation then we are in now. THOMAS G. ZIMMERMAN Flushing, Queens
